title: September 18
description:
This was kind of a star spangled week. Never let it be said that the Moses family aren't patriotic joiners, because this week we:
  • Joined corporate America.
  • Joined the Boy Scouts of America.
  • Joined president Obama's stimulus plan by rolling out our own jobs creation program. We've hired a UC Berkeley college student to pick up Felix and Milo from school twice a week.

children.title: Cooper
children.description:
After a year of telecommuting in underwear, both Dean and Lucie have piloted the Good Ship Income into the (very) charted waters of corporate America.

We've started dry cleaning clothes again. We're taking significantly more showers. No more Skype videoconferences wearing a dress shirt and pajama bottoms.

Lucie's on a multi-month project at Cooper, one of her favorite design agencies. This is the view from her office in San Francisco.

children.title: Salesforce
children.description:
Dean just finished his first week at Salesforce, recently named by Forbes as the world's most innovative company. Salesforce didn't invent the cloud, but they've probably got the marketing trademark on it.

Salesforce's headquarters are in this building. It's where Dean's old company Epicentric was. In fact, he's sitting on the same floor, not 30 feet from his old desk!

Cooper and Salesforce are within three blocks of each other. We've already run into each other at lunch.

children.title: Date Night
children.description:
Another big change: we have a babysitter, a junior at UC Berkeley. She picks up the kids from school two days a week so that Lucie doesn't have to get home so early. The kids love her.

On Friday she keeps the kids all evening so that we don't even have to come home. Date night!

This Friday we walked over to an oyster bar in the Ferry Building, met some friends, and watched the sun set over the bay.

children.title: Date Night 2
children.description:
Dean and Lucie are LOVING date night. We walk to meet each other after work, have dinner with friends, maybe see a movie, and in general have a civilized, adult time.

It's very, very, very nice.

children.title: The Scout Experience
children.description:
Another big change: both boys have joined the Boy Scouts of America.

They meet in a church near our house. We're going on a campout next weekend. Felix and Milo (and Lucie) are going to have to learn the Pledge of Allegiance! We're a little uncomfortable with Scouts because there's too much emphasis on obedience and very little on critical thinking, but the kids are into it and they get the critical thinking elsewhere.

This weekend we picked up the uniforms at the official Scout store in San Leandro. Like everything else about the scouts, it was a funky trip back to the 1950's.

Milo doesn't want his picture taken here because we haven't located the official neckerchief yet.

children.title: The Webelo
children.description:
OMG, Felix looks so old to us here!

He's in the Webelos, which is Scouts for 9 and 10 year olds. "Webelos" stands for:

We'll
Be
Loyal
Scouts

children.title: Troop 30
children.description: Both Felix and Milo are in Troop 30, but are in different "Dens".   Troop 30 has two dens of Webelos and three dens of younger cub scouts.

children.title: Translator Badge
children.description:
Felix and Milo were able to earn their first badge at the store.

To receive the Interpreter badge, each had to sign a paper saying he was fluent in a foreign language.

children.title: Wookie Scout
children.description:
A Webelo:
  1. Gets a nickname, usually an animal name. Felix chose "Chewbacca" because of a game that was played at his first den meeting.
  2. Is allowed make his own neckerchief clasp.
These two things are not usually related, but Felix was adamant that they should be.

children.title: The Rookie Wookie
children.description: Scout Felix, doing his very first scouting assignment.

children.title: Citizen Wookie
children.description:
We're clearly not in France anymore.

Felix's task: make a poster about "Citizenship" for the upcoming Pack meeting.

children.title: Proud to be a Posterboard
children.description:
We learned about our civic leaders:
  • Barak Obama, the President (everyone knew this one).
  • Joe Biden, the Vice President (3 of 4 Mosii were fuzzy on this one).
  • Jerry Brown, California's governor (2 of 4 Mosii had no clue).
  • Tom Bates, Berkeley's mayor (even the 4th Mosii had to think a little to come up with this one).

children.title: iPod Scout
children.description:
Milo is a Wolf Scout.

While his brother Webelo toils through a civics lesson, the Wolf Scout surfs dad's iPod.

children.title: For Those About To Rock...
children.description: We have practiced the official salute, the official sign (two fingers in the air), and the official handshake (we could tell you but we'd have to kill you).

children.title: We Salute You
children.description: Lucie's going around the house muttering "so cute! so so cute!" under her breath.

children.title: Connor
children.description: In other news, Felix had an absolutely amazing must-it-ever-end sleepover with Connor.

children.title: The Corcorans
children.description: Then Connor, his parents and his two twin sisters came over for an absolutely amazing must-it-ever-end Sunday brunch.

children.title: I Am A Rock
children.description: Felix decides what Scouting really needs is a strong dose of martial artistry.

children.title: Ninja Scouts of America
children.description: Demonstrating the deadly tent pitching stance?

children.title: Homies
children.description: These guys really are the best brothers ever.  They play together all the time.  Even when one has a friend over, he generally includes the other in their games.

children.title: Bros
children.description:
Milo accords Felix the dues of an older brother: Felix has a bit more say in what they play, sometimes Milo's happy to "just watch", Milo thinks Felix is old enough for a Nintendo DS but not himself, etc.

Milo even understands that the younger brother is going to take a few more lumps from the older brother than he gives, though Felix is such a sweetie that he almost never asserts that fraternal right of the jungle.
